p: The epidemiological characteristics of arthropod-borne viral infections (arbovirosis) are changing worldwide. This represents a serious threat to public health due to the presence of emerging and/or reemerging viruses with high epidemic potential [ 1]. Arboviruses such as the Dengue virus (DENV), the Yellow fever virus (YFV), West Nile virus (WNV) among other viruses are endemic in the region and can, unpredictably, cause new epidemics [ 2, 3].
